intro: Rosemary oil is a popular infused oil used in cooking and beauty treatments. If you want to make rosemary oil quickly, heat a few sprigs of fresh rosemary in your oil of choice. However, keep in mind that this oil must be used within a week or it could go rancid. Alternatively, use dried rosemary to create an oil with a longer shelf life. Dried rosemary can be mixed with your oil of choice in a canning jar and set in a sunny place to slowly infuse into an edible oil. This method can be used with prepackaged dried rosemary or your own homemade dried rosemary.

steps.title: Refrigerate the oil.
steps.subtitle: Oils infused with fresh herbs should be refrigerated and used within the week. This will prevent the growth of any harmful bacteria that could cause the oil to become rancid.
sub-points: If the oil is a gift, be sure to include a “use by” date on the label.

steps.title: Store the rosemary in your pantry.
steps.subtitle: Pour the strained olive oil back into the canning jar and replace the lid. If you want, add a sprig of dried rosemary to the oil for decoration. Oils infused with dried herbs have a shelf life of one year.
sub-points: If you move the oil to a new jar, sterilize the jar first.
